roles.name: Recruitment Specialist
roles.description: Sources and screens candidates, manages hiring processes, and aligns workforce needs with organizational strategy.

meta.typicalBackground: HR or psychology background, networking skills, proficient in applicant tracking systems
challenges: Competition for top talent, unconscious bias, ensuring legal compliance (EEO)

sampleUseCase.scenario: A recruiter uses social media campaigns and skill-based testing to fill critical software engineering roles in half the usual timeframe.

roles.name: Career Counselor
roles.description: Guides individuals on career paths, skill development, and job search strategies, often in educational or workforce development contexts.

meta.typicalBackground: Counseling or psychology degree, certified in career guidance, strong interpersonal skills
challenges: Varying job market conditions, personal constraints of clients (family, finances), balancing aspirations vs. realism

sampleUseCase.scenario: A counselor helps a mid-career individual transition from manufacturing to logistics by identifying transferable skills, recommending short certifications, and connecting them with potential employers.

roles.name: Workforce Developer
roles.description: Implements community or regional programs to upskill, reskill, and place jobseekers into growth industries.

meta.typicalBackground: Public administration, vocational education, or labor economics, strong stakeholder networking
challenges: Funding continuity, employer engagement, measuring long-term job retention or wage growth

sampleUseCase.scenario: A workforce developer partners with local tech companies and a community college to set up a coding bootcamp, resulting in a 75% placement rate for graduates in entry-level IT roles.

roles.name: HR Policy Advisor
roles.description: Advises on labor regulations, organizational policies (compensation, diversity, welfare) ensuring fair and legal practices.

meta.typicalBackground: Human resources or legal expertise, knowledge of labor law, negotiation skills
challenges: Navigating complex federal/state laws, union negotiations, ensuring equitable pay structures

sampleUseCase.scenario: The advisor updates HR guidelines to accommodate remote work arrangements post-COVID, ensuring compliance with labor codes and equitable treatment for all employees.

roles.name: Labor Market Analyst
roles.description: Studies employment trends, wage data, and industry growth to forecast job demand and inform policymakers or employers.

meta.typicalBackground: Economics or labor studies, strong statistical methods, data interpretation
challenges: Rapid market shifts, incomplete data from gig/informal sectors, macroeconomic uncertainties

sampleUseCase.scenario: A labor market analyst analyzes local job postings and wage data, advising a city to invest in advanced manufacturing training programs where growth is predicted to outpace supply.
